intro: Voyria aurantiaca subsp. monantha, commonly known as the single-flowered voyria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive orange-red flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are borne in dense clusters and are known for their vibrant coloration. The subspecies is distinguished by its solitary flowers, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
